p: With the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, health care providers must recognize the relationship between mental illness and viral illness to better treat patients. Although this case cannot support causation, it does stress the bidirectional effects that physical and mental illness share. Certainly, this patient had social stressors prior to his suicide attempt; however, coexisting COVID-19 infection could have exacerbated the effects of these social stressors on his mental health and vice versa. Health care professionals and society should take note of these associations with the current pandemic and its ramifications.
